result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas L Vetter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Arson w/ Intent to Defraud, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.04.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
-Restitution set at $0 
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected during term probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job .
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no loner use or possess any firearms or body armor; he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

Cooperate with agent.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas L Vetter

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicholas L Vetter in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0  DAYS time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2  YEARS with the following conditions:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
-Restitution set at $0 
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected during term probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Perform 50 hours of community service

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no loner use or possess any firearms or body armor; he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored. 

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Nicholas L Vetter in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.  State requests a Presentence Investigaiton Report.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Nicholas L Vetter in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court in trial.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nicholas L Vetter in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference conducted.  Parties may have reached a resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Nicholas L Vetter in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Jeremy Arn for Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 05-20-2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Nicholas L Vetter
Current: 1020 Philippen Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220   (Effective: 05-05-2015)
Prior: 1020 Philippen Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220

As an additional condition of bail:
Oral No Contact Order with the co-actor

Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Nicholas L Vetter in court with Attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-086

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
Court orders case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
